section.title: Create Project
section.p: The Create Project button is used to create a new empty project.
Click Create Project to launch the following:

ul.li: Name: Name of the project. Minimum of 3 characters, maximum of 100 characters. Must not duplicate the name of an existing project.
Description: An optional description of the project.

section.title: Create Profile
section.p: The Create Profile button is used to create a new profile.
Click Create Profile to launch the following:

ul.li: Profile Name: Name of the profile. Minimum of 3 characters, maximum of 100 characters.
Node Type: All node types that profiles can be created for.
Upgrade Package: All imported software packages for the selected Node Type.
OSS Model Identity: All OSS Model Identities supported for the selected Node Type.

section.p: Click Create... to continue. See tutorials for more information.

section.title: Configuration Details
section.p: The Configuration Details pane is used to view optional additional information about an existing profile.
The following may be displayed:

ul.li: Node Type: An expandable tree structure respresenting the hierarchy of configurations in the profile.
Diagram: A diagram representing a logical view of the components that will be configured by the profile.

section.p: Note: Profiles for certain node types may not generate this information when created.

section.title: Edit Profile
section.p: The Edit Profile button is used to edit an existing profile.
Click Edit Profile to launch the following:

ul.li: Upgrade Package: All imported software packages for the selected node type.
OSS Model Identity: All OSS Model Identities supported for the selected node type.

section.p: Click Edit... to continue.

section.title: Delete Profile
section.p: The Delete Profile button is used to delete an existing profile.
Click Delete Profile to launch the following:
Click Delete to permanently delete the profile.

section.title: Export CIQ
section.p: Export CIQ generates a template Customer Information Questionnaire (CIQ) for the profile. The parameters and descriptions will be prepopulated, but the values are blank.
Click Export CIQ to download a xlsx file, which is required for input of site specific values for node roll-out.

section.title: Import CIQ
section.p: Import CIQ generates node configurations based on a user-completed Customer Information Questionnaire generated from the profile.
Click Import CIQ to upload a xlsx file which contains site specific values for node roll-out.

section.title: Order
section.p: Before a valid CIQ is imported, the Node Details section will be empty.

image.alt: Summary of Nodes Configurations when none are created using a Profile

section.p: When a valid CIQ is imported, you can view the nodes that are ready for order, with warnings if available.

image.alt: Summary of Nodes Configurations created using a Profile

section.p: When a valid CIQ is imported successfully, click Order to initiate the order.
When the order has initiated, a dialog will be displayed:
Click Monitor Integration to display the Project Status Tab.
Click Continue Provisioning to close the dialog.
